page.title: 05Coniston Landowners
page.content: Because this area has such{outstanding {natural beauty}(and because this fact is such an asset to many people and organisations), great care is taken to ensure that the natural features are not spoiled, and that development of the area is within certain limits. The area is within the{Lake District {National Park;}there is good access to open areas for visitors, and a{public {launching site}on Coniston Water. Large{land-owners}have a great impact on the landscape in this area: the {National Trust}owns Coniston Hall Farm and other sites, the{Forestry {Commission}owns much of the woodland to the E of the lake. New development is, of course, allowed - under strict controls - and{planning {permission}must in most cases be obtained from the{Lake District {Special Planning Board.
